column4: sudo rmmod ath5k_pci first, add "blacklist ath5k_pci" to /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist (to keep it from reappearing on reboot) ... "sudo modprobe ath_pci" and again, to keep that in the future, add "ath_pci" to /etc/modules (this is untested but the logic should be ok)
Yep, thanks. Just managed to find a guide telling me that :)
np :)
Unfortunately, that didn't work...
Any other ideas?
any error messages to start debugging the issue ?
FATAL: Module ath5k_pci not found.
BUT connection information says clearly "Driver: ath5k_pci"
i see, i thought you had that module loaded, try lsmod | grep ath to check what you have running right now
Oh, it's actually ath5k not ath5k_pci
well that should clear things up
Thanks very much. We'll see how this goes. :)
you're welcome, hope it works this time around
Unfortunately, that didn't work. Wireless was not an option after loading the ath_pci driver, but I'm sure I loaded that driver in Arch Linux so I'm quite sure it works.
I'm trying to get this working because Arch Linux had a much better connection to the wireless than Ubuntu so I'm assuming it's a driver issue.
too bad indeed, out of ideas on this one i'm afraid
Alrighty. Thanks all the same. :)
Nevermind! Forgot to do modprobe -r ath5k before modprobe ath_pci!
My connection looks a lot faster now. :D
Thank you very much! :D
nice catch heh
